p: Introduced populations had more negative root water potentials and higher rates of AMF colonization ( F 1, 13 = 4.8, P = 0.0483) than native populations ( Figure 3 and Table 1). Both root water potential and AMF colonization did not significantly vary with population (origin) (AMF: F 13, 49 = 1.4, P = 0.2085; Figure 3 and Table 1). Root water potentials were less negative in the July block ( Figure 3 and Table 1) but there were no significant interactions between population origin and time block or population(origin) and time block.
